text: Little Fighter is a single and multiplayer beat 'em up game designed and developed by Marti Wong. It was released in 1995. == Gameplay == In this game, players can choose to play as one of 11 characters. Each character has exactly 3 special moves. Players participate in a battle in three different modes. The game allows for a one on one match, team matches or elimination tournament matches. There can be up to 8 fighters simultaneously on screen. There can be up to 4 human players on the same game. Playing with a joystick is also an available option, making the game more versatile. ==Sequels== Little Fighter 2 is the sequel to Little Fighter. It was created by Marti Wong and Starsky Wong in 1999. After the release, it had several updates. In 2005, Marti Wong collaborated with Oscar Chu, to release the MMO sequel Little Fighter Online. ==References== Category:1995 video games Category:Beat 'em ups Category:DOS games Category:DOS-only games Category:Free-to-play video games Category:Free online games Category:Video games developed in Hong Kong
